jobs.descriptionPlain:
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 4 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform’s flexibility, security and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers. 


WHAT WE DO

The Automotive Integration team onboards new automotive customers, integrates their embedded platforms with our product offerings, implements custom solutions on demand, and provides post-launch technical support. We monitor the quality of our products through key performance indicators (KPIs) collected from the automotive customer's hardware and ensure they use our SDKs most efficiently by fine-tuning our products accordingly. Our product is the entire Mapbox platform that makes a great in-vehicle navigation experience, from a fully functional integrated solution such as Mapbox Dash to individual components such as the Mapbox Maps SDK, targeting Linux Embedded platforms. Our solutions power experiences and operations for customers like BMW, GM, and Toyota, with the portfolio in rapid expansion.

https://www.mapbox.com/navigation 

https://www.mapbox.com/automotive 

We are looking for smart, fast-learning team players driven by the idea of interfacing directly with automotive customers and providing fine-tuned solutions to extract the best experience out of our products in their embedded environments, pushing the envelope of the best navigation solution in the market.


WHAT YOU'LL DO

Joining us as a Senior C++ Developer, you'll play a key role in developing software/tech for complex automotive navigation systems in Linux Embedded platforms.

Your responsibilities will include:

 - Understand the minimum requirements for our automotive solutions, map those against the reference platforms, and monitor KPIs by collecting metrics from the automotive customers' development benches or cars.

 - Write clean, fast code to integrate various data inputs required for our automotive navigation system product offerings, or provide custom-tailored solutions as needed.

 - Fine-tune the automotive navigation experience through profiling and debugging techniques to extract the best experience from our customer's automotive platforms.

 - Work with technical counterparts at customers and partners to discover requirements, provide implementation recommendations, and debug integrations.

 - Collaborate with internal teams to ensure best practices for cross-platform API design and performance tuning for specific hardware and software combinations.

 - Investigate and triage technical issues between Mapbox, customers, and Tier 1 partners.

 - Develop the best ways to solve technical challenges within existing technological and business constraints.

 - Improve the product’s performance, stability, maintainability, and simplicity.


WHAT WE BELIEVE ARE IMPORTANT TRAITS FOR THIS ROLE

 - Business speaking level in Japanese and fluency in English speaking.

 - Broad experience in software development and customer engagements.

 - Passionate about programming and a strong focus on performance aspects.

 - Experience with automotive compliance standards

 - Strong proficiency in the following areas:
   
   - Programming languages: C++
   
   - Scripting languages: Shell Script, JavaScript, Python
   
   - Build systems: CMake, Gradle, Ninja
   
   - Orchestration environments: Yocto, Docker

 - Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with distributed teams and customers/partners.

 - Experience with building frameworks and developer tools.

 - Passionate to earn and keep customer trust.

Helpful experiences that are a plus but not a requirement:

 - Automotive Grade Linux (AGL)

 - Automotive CAN bus experience.

 - AOSP, Android Automotive experience

 - Window management experience e.g. X11, Wayland.

 - Cross-platform experience with toolkits like Qt or Flutter.


WHAT WE VALUE

In addition to our core values https://www.mapbox.com/about/values/, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

 - We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

 - We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for life's unexpected events, and innovation in how we support our people.

 - We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

 - We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you agree to the Mapbox Privacy Policy https://www.mapbox.com/legal/privacy which is linked here.

We are committed to a fair and equitable hiring process. We do not discriminate against any protected class.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager, Navigation SDK
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 4 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform’s flexibility, security and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers. 

What We Do

The Navigation SDK team builds frameworks and applications that power navigation everywhere. Customers of our SDK include automotive, logistics and consumer apps on Android, iOS and Linux, small and large. Our customers build apps and navigation experiences that top the App Store and Play Store rankings, and we are constantly working together to help them build what’s next, whether that’s an Augmented Reality app, an AI powered experience, a popular consumer app, or an autonomous driving experience.

What You'll Do

As an Engineering Manager, you’ll lead the Nav SDK team in advancing the maps and navigation ecosystem at Mapbox. In this role, you will:

  • Mentor and Develop Talent: Support and inspire engineers, fostering a culture of growth, creativity, and innovation.

  • Promote Collaboration and Innovation: Build an inclusive and collaborative environment where data-driven decisions fuel success.

  • Drive Strategic Objectives: Align your team’s work with company and product goals, ensuring strategic cohesion.

  • Define Product Roadmaps: Partner with Product and Engineering teams to shape the roadmap for our Maps SDKs.

  • Shape the Vision: Play a key role in envisioning and evolving our rendering engines, contributing to business and product planning.

What We Believe are Important Traits for This Role

  • Leadership Experience: Proven success managing technical teams to deliver impactful products.

  • Technical Expertise: Familiarity with mobile development frameworks, tools, and best practices for building and deploying mobile apps across platforms.

  • Talent Acquisition and Development: A track record of hiring and growing top technical talent.

  • Operational Excellence: Commitment to monitoring, metrics, and continuous improvement processes.

  • High Standards and Quality: Balancing speed and quality to uphold an excellent developer experience.

  • Ownership and Execution: Confidence in leading vision, strategy, and execution for high-impact projects.

  • Customer Focus: Passion for solving customer problems and delivering delightful experiences.

Nice to Have

  • Experience in Mobile SDK Development, including architecture and design patterns.

  • Knowledge of Maps and Location Technologies, such as GIS systems.

What We Value

In addition to our core values, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

  • We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

  • We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.

  • We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

  • We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you have received the Mapbox Non-US Privacy Notice for applicants, which is linked here.  Completing this application requires you to provide personal data, such as your name and contact information, which is mandatory for Mapbox to process your application. 

We are committed to a fair and equitable hiring process. We do not discriminate against any protected class.

jobs.title: Strategic Account Manager,  Arabic Speaking
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 4 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform’s flexibility, security and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers. 

What You'll Do

  •  Reporting to the Head of EMEA, you will build and own relationships with Mapbox’s most strategic customers, from first contact to product launch and beyond, ensuring that we grow with them.

  • Source new business revenues from a small list of targets you will own and continue to nurture, grow & expand those accounts.

  • Align closely with strategic customers to build deep relationships whilst executing timely renewals, upsell and expansion opportunities across the account.

  • Combine Mapbox building blocks with deep customer knowledge to present compelling technical solutions with clear business outcomes.

  • Communicate customer/prospect needs and industry patterns back to Mapbox product teams to influence our technical roadmap.

  • Develop and execute strategies to expand Mapbox’s adoption in key industry verticals, working closely with the marketing team to tell our customers’ success stories.

  • Mentor more junior members of the sales team to help grow talent internally.

What We Believe are Important Traits for This Role

  •  Strong technical sales aptitude demonstrated through a combination of industry experience, size and complexity of deals closed (you’ll be focused on six and seven-figure opportunities), and rapport with engineers and product owners.

  • Prospecting skills using LinkedIn, Sales Navigator and identification tools to help you source new leads.

  • Ability to navigate complex customer relationships, developing trust and influence with engineers and developers up to C-level leadership.

  • Ability to collaborate across Mapbox teams including engineering, support, and marketing to close business and ensure successful customer launches.

  • Deep curiosity, empathy, and grit — we’re partnering with our customers to solve hard problems, and we win as a team.

  • A level of diligence regarding capture, update & reporting of key data within your territory.

What We Value

In addition to our core values, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

  • We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

  • We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.

  • We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

  • We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you have received the Mapbox Non-US Privacy Notice for applicants, which is linked here.  Completing this application requires you to provide personal data, such as your name and contact information, which is mandatory for Mapbox to process your application. 

We are committed to a fair and equitable hiring process. We do not discriminate against any protected class.

 -  Strong technical sales aptitude demonstrated through a combination of industry experience, size and complexity of deals closed (you’ll be focused on six and seven-figure opportunities), and rapport with engineers and product owners.

 - Prospecting skills using LinkedIn, Sales Navigator and identification tools to help you source new leads.

 - Ability to navigate complex customer relationships, developing trust and influence with engineers and developers up to C-level leadership.

 - Ability to collaborate across Mapbox teams including engineering, support, and marketing to close business and ensure successful customer launches.

 - Deep curiosity, empathy, and grit — we’re partnering with our customers to solve hard problems, and we win as a team.

 - A level of diligence regarding capture, update & reporting of key data within your territory.


WHAT WE VALUE

In addition to our core values https://www.mapbox.com/about/values/, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

 - We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

 - We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.

 - We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

 - We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you have received the Mapbox Non-US Privacy Notice https://www.mapbox.com/legal/applicant-privacy-notice/ for applicants, which is linked here.  Completing this application requires you to provide personal data, such as your name and contact information, which is mandatory for Mapbox to process your application.

jobs.title: Automotive Senior Solutions Architect (Korean Speaking)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 4 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform’s flexibility, security and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers. 

What You'll Do

Solutions Architects are trusted technical and business advisors who partner with customers to design, prototype, and deliver solutions on the Mapbox platform. You connect business needs with technical possibilities, helping customers turn data, mobility, and mapping into effective digital experiences. You collaborate with account managers to lead technical engagements — from discovery and design to solution validation and deployment. You guide customers in using Mapbox products strategically to achieve measurable business outcomes.

This role is ideal for someone who combines technical depth with commercial acumen, enjoys working directly with customers, and thrives at the intersection of strategy, architecture, and delivery.

  • Solution Architecture: Design and present scalable, architectures using Mapbox SDKs, APIs, and platform services.

  • Technical Discovery: Lead technical discussions to identify customer goals, challenges, and requirements.

  • Prototyping & Proof of Value: Build and deliver proof-of-concept solutions that demonstrate customer value.

  • Pre-Sales Enablement: Partner with Account Executives to position technical differentiation and shape opportunities.

  • Location Intelligence: Apply expertise in GIS, spatial data processing, and business value.

  • Stakeholder Engagement: Communicate effectively with developers, architects, and senior decision-makers.

  • Customer Advocacy: Provide structured feedback from the field, and raise feature requests to influence Mapbox product and engineering roadmaps.

  • Continuous Learning: Stay current on emerging technologies in mapping, visualization, mobility, and AI.

  • Collaborate with automotive customers and partners on navigation, ADAS, connected vehicles, and software-defined vehicles.

  • Design and validate architectures for real-time telemetry, routing, and EV ecosystem solutions.

  • Work with embedded systems, vehicle E/E architectures, and map delivery pipelines.

  • Partner with OEMs and Tier-1 suppliers, supporting integration of Mapbox technologies into in-vehicle systems and connected platforms.

  • Engage with cross-functional teams to define, test, and scale innovative in-vehicle experiences powered by Mapbox.

What We Believe are Important Traits for This Role

  • Experience: 8+ years in solutions architecture, pre-sales engineering, or enterprise consulting with a record of customer-facing success.

  • Language: Fluent in Korean and English (both written and verbal communication)

  • Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (preferred).

  • Domain Expertise: Proven experience with GIS, location intelligence, and geospatial data processing, including spatial databases, vector and raster data, geocoding, routing, and map rendering.

  • Technical Skills

    • Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (certification in AWS, Azure, or GCP is desirable).

    • Proven experience with web and mobile technologies (Required: JavaScript. Highly desirable: Swift, Kotlin, Python. Desirable: React Native, Flutter).

    • Proven experience with back-end APIs and front-end SDKs in geospatial and mobility domains.

  • Architecture & Design: Proven ability to translate complex requirements into scalable, robust technical architectures aligned with customer objectives.

  • Solution Selling: Demonstrated ability to articulate how technical architectures deliver business value, connecting design decisions to commercial outcomes and ROI.

  • Collaboration: Proven ability to work autonomously while effectively partnering across distributed, cross-functional teams (Sales, Product, Engineering, and Customer Success).

  • Communication: Exceptional written, verbal, and presentation skills with both technical and executive audiences.

  • Strategic Mindset: Capable of bridging high-level business strategy with technical implementation.

  • Mobility: Willingness to travel up to 25% for customer meetings, workshops, and industry events.

  • Experience collaborating with OEMs and Tier-1 suppliers, preferably in navigation, ADAS, connected-vehicle, or SDV programs.

  • Understanding of automotive software stacks, E/E architectures, and middleware integration.

  • Familiarity with vehicle data telemetry, map delivery, and over-the-air (OTA) update workflows.

  • Experience in real-time systems, embedded development environments, or automotive cloud connectivity.

  • Ability to operate within automotive lifecycle processes (requirements management, validation, homologation).

What We Value

In addition to our core values, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

  • We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

  • We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.

  • We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

  • We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you have received the Mapbox Non-US Privacy Notice for applicants, which is linked here.  Completing this application requires you to provide personal data, such as your name and contact information, which is mandatory for Mapbox to process your application. 

We are committed to a fair and equitable hiring process. We do not discriminate against any protected class.

  • Customer Advocacy: Provide structured feedback from the field, and raise feature requests to influence Mapbox product and engineering roadmaps.

  • Continuous Learning: Stay current on emerging technologies in mapping, visualization, mobility, and AI.

  • Support enterprise customers across multiple domains, focusing on On-Demand Logistics, Telecommunications, and Weather.

  • Advise on cloud-native architectures, cloud and on-premise solutions, back-office APIs, and client-side SDKs for global deployments.

  • Review Mapbox solutions in alignment with customers’ data warehouses, business intelligence, and geospatial analytics workflows.

  • Collaborate with customers to define technical success criteria and ensure solution designs meet business objectives.

What We Believe are Important Traits for This Role

  • Experience: 8+ years in solutions architecture, pre-sales engineering, or enterprise consulting with a record of customer-facing success.

  • Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (preferred).

  • Domain Expertise: Proven experience with GIS, location intelligence, and geospatial data processing, including spatial databases, vector and raster data, geocoding, routing, and map rendering.

  • Technical Skills

    • Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (certification in AWS, Azure, or GCP is desirable).

    • Proven experience with web and mobile technologies (Required: JavaScript. Highly desirable: Swift, Kotlin, Python. Desirable: React Native, Flutter).

    • Proven experience with back-end APIs and front-end SDKs in geospatial and mobility domains.

  • Architecture & Design: Proven ability to translate complex requirements into scalable, robust technical architectures aligned with customer objectives.

  • Solution Selling: Demonstrated ability to articulate how technical architectures deliver business value, connecting design decisions to commercial outcomes and ROI.

  • Collaboration: Proven ability to work autonomously while effectively partnering across distributed, cross-functional teams (Sales, Product, Engineering, and Customer Success).

  • Communication: Exceptional written, verbal, and presentation skills with both technical and executive audiences.

  • Strategic Mindset: Capable of bridging high-level business strategy with technical implementation.

  • Mobility: Willingness to travel up to 25% for customer meetings, workshops, and industry events.

  • Experience working with large enterprise customers across multiple domains, including On-Demand Logistics, Telecommunications, and Weather.

  • Sphere of influence to engage and abstract solutions across Exec, Product, Project, Engineering Managers, and Developers

  • Proven capability to lead technical discovery and workshops in complex enterprise ecosystems.

What We Value

In addition to our core values, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

  • We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

  • We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.

  • We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

  • We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you have received the Mapbox Non-US Privacy Notice for applicants, which is linked here.  Completing this application requires you to provide personal data, such as your name and contact information, which is mandatory for Mapbox to process your application. 

We are committed to a fair and equitable hiring process. We do not discriminate against any protected class.

jobs.title: Senior Solutions Architect, Enterprise
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 4 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform’s flexibility, security and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers. 

What You'll Do

Solutions Architects are trusted technical and business advisors who partner with customers to design, prototype, and deliver solutions on the Mapbox platform. You connect business needs with technical possibilities, helping customers turn data, mobility, and mapping into effective digital experiences. You collaborate with account managers to lead technical engagements — from discovery and design to solution validation and deployment. You guide customers in using Mapbox products strategically to achieve measurable business outcomes.

This role is ideal for someone who combines technical depth with commercial acumen, enjoys working directly with customers, and thrives at the intersection of strategy, architecture, and delivery.

  • Solution Architecture: Design and present scalable, architectures using Mapbox SDKs, APIs, and platform services.

  • Technical Discovery: Lead technical discussions to identify customer goals, challenges, and requirements.

  • Prototyping & Proof of Value: Build and deliver proof-of-concept solutions that demonstrate customer value.

  • Pre-Sales Enablement: Partner with Account Executives to position technical differentiation and shape opportunities.

  • Location Intelligence: Apply expertise in GIS, spatial data processing, and business value.

  • Stakeholder Engagement: Communicate effectively with developers, architects, and senior decision-makers.

  • Customer Advocacy: Provide structured feedback from the field, and raise feature requests to influence Mapbox product and engineering roadmaps.

  • Continuous Learning: Stay current on emerging technologies in mapping, visualization, mobility, and AI.

  • Support enterprise customers across multiple domains, focusing on On-Demand Logistics, Telecommunications, and Weather.

  • Advise on cloud-native architectures, cloud and on-premise solutions, back-office APIs, and client-side SDKs for global deployments.

  • Review Mapbox solutions in alignment with customers’ data warehouses, business intelligence, and geospatial analytics workflows.

  • Collaborate with customers to define technical success criteria and ensure solution designs meet business objectives.

What We Believe are Important Traits for This Role

  • Experience: 8+ years in solutions architecture, pre-sales engineering, or enterprise consulting with a record of customer-facing success.

  • Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (preferred).

  • Domain Expertise: Proven experience with GIS, location intelligence, and geospatial data processing, including spatial databases, vector and raster data, geocoding, routing, and map rendering.

  • Technical Skills

    • Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (certification in AWS, Azure, or GCP is desirable).

    • Proven experience with web and mobile technologies (Required: JavaScript. Highly desirable: Swift, Kotlin, Python. Desirable: React Native, Flutter).

    • Proven experience with back-end APIs and front-end SDKs in geospatial and mobility domains.

  • Architecture & Design: Proven ability to translate complex requirements into scalable, robust technical architectures aligned with customer objectives.

  • Solution Selling: Demonstrated ability to articulate how technical architectures deliver business value, connecting design decisions to commercial outcomes and ROI.

  • Collaboration: Proven ability to work autonomously while effectively partnering across distributed, cross-functional teams (Sales, Product, Engineering, and Customer Success).

  • Communication: Exceptional written, verbal, and presentation skills with both technical and executive audiences.

  • Strategic Mindset: Capable of bridging high-level business strategy with technical implementation.

  • Mobility: Willingness to travel up to 25% for customer meetings, workshops, and industry events.

  • Experience working with large enterprise customers across multiple domains, including On-Demand Logistics, Telecommunications, and Weather.

  • Sphere of influence to engage and abstract solutions across Exec, Product, Project, Engineering Managers, and Developers

  • Proven capability to lead technical discovery and workshops in complex enterprise ecosystems.

What We Value

In addition to our core values, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

  • We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

  • We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.

  • We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

  • We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you have received the Mapbox Non-US Privacy Notice for applicants, which is linked here.  Completing this application requires you to provide personal data, such as your name and contact information, which is mandatory for Mapbox to process your application. 

We are committed to a fair and equitable hiring process. We do not discriminate against any protected class.

jobs.title: Senior Technical Revenue Accountant
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 4 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform’s flexibility, security and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers. 

What You'll Do

  • Manage and lead in the preparation, review, and approval of customer contracts, ensuring appropriate recognition in accordance with ASC 606, while providing support and guidance by partnering with Sales, Legal, and Revenue Operations teams on deal structure, contractual terms, and revenue guidance implementation.

  • Own and evolve our ASC 606 revenue policies, including SSP analyses and allocations, as new products, pricing models and contract structures are introduced

  • Serve as one of the company’s subject matter experts on ASC 606, owning the end-to-end revenue accounting process.

  • Own month-end and quarter-end tasks, including preparing workbooks, journal entries, and technical whitepapers and memos under ASC 606

  • Lead in the preparation of Technical Revenue Accounting ad hoc projects (SSP Analysis, Customer Life Analysis, Revenue Policies).

  • Streamline non-standard contract workflows with Legal and Deal Desk to balance compliance and business objectives

  • Support internal and external audits, including audit schedules and responses to technical accounting inquiries 

What We Believe are Important Traits for This Role

  •  Is proficient with Microsoft Excel, NetSuite, and Salesforce.

  • 5+ years of relevant experience with a strong focus on technical revenue accounting under ASC 606

  • CPA License

  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to distill complex technical issues into clear, actionable guidance

  • Proven ability to work cross-functionally

  • Ability to balance technical rigor with operational excellence

  • Willing to roll up their sleeves and take on all aspects of the team’s work, from round robin tasks to complex technical projects.

What We Value

In addition to our core values, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

  • We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

  • We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.

  • We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

  • We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

Our annual base compensation for this role ranges from $151,300 - $204,700 for most US locations and 5% to 10% higher for US locations with a higher cost of labor. Job level and actual compensation will be decided based on factors including, but not limited to, individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process (including skills and prior relevant experience, potential impact, and scope of role), market demands, and specific work location. Please discuss your specific work location with your recruiter for more information.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you agree to the Mapbox Privacy Policy which is linked here.

Mapbox participates in E-Verify to confirm employee work authorization. Please refer to the Notice of E-Verify Participation and Right to Work posters for more information.

We are committed to a fair and equitable hiring process. We do not discriminate against any protected class.

jobs.title: Field Testing Specialist (12-month Contract)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 4 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform’s flexibility, security and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers. 

What We Do

The Driver Operations team conducts weekly in-vehicle testing to support cross-functional development and validation efforts. Each week, we build a prioritized test plan based on incoming requests, delivery timelines, and business needs. We execute against this plan with tight coordination and clear, real-time communication to ensure test objectives are met and actionable feedback is delivered efficiently. We are constantly behind the wheel, executing test cycles, supporting special R&D activations, and representing the team in high-visibility initiatives for both internal and external stakeholders.

What You'll Do

As a Field Testing Specialist, you’ll be responsible for planning, coordinating, and executing in-vehicle testing across global regions to support product development, executive demos, and field validation. You’ll work closely with engineering, product, and program teams to intake testing requests, clarify requirements, and translate them into actionable test plans. You’ll manage driver resources, both internal and external, to ensure testing is executed accurately and on schedule, while also contributing hands-on support.

Success in this role requires a strong foundation in automotive test coordination, with the ability to troubleshoot both hardware and software systems and a solid understanding of vehicle electronics, navigation, and mapping technologies. We're looking for someone genuinely excited about in-vehicle testing, energized by real-world environments, and eager to test complex systems on the road. You should be comfortable working hands-on, whether behind the wheel or alongside drivers, and skilled at connecting field execution with internal teams to surface issues, ensure alignment, and drive continuous improvement. Experience in advanced development environments within OEMs is a plus, as are sharp observational skills and a passion for delivering quality.

In this role, you will:

  • Intake and synthesize testing requests from cross-functional teams

  • Convert requirements to reliable and detailed test cases

  • Define and prioritize weekly test plans based on scope, urgency, and resource availability

  • Coordinate global test execution across internal drivers and third-party partners

  • Perform in-vehicle drive testing to support quality testing, demo execution, product releases, and ad hoc business needs

  • Assist in the management of Mapbox’s domestic and international testing fleet

  • Surface bugs, blockers, or feature insights through structured feedback

  • Contribute to the tracking and reporting of testing metrics

  • Develop deep functional knowledge of Mapbox products through hands-on testing

  • Maintain clear, proactive communication with stakeholders throughout the test lifecycle 

What We Believe are Important Traits for This Role

  • 5+ years of experience – Automotive testing coordination or other relevant testing experience with an automotive focus

  • Technical fluency – Comfortable working with both hardware and software in test environments; able to independently troubleshoot, configure, and log issues in-vehicle

  • Familiarity with automotive systems – Understanding of typical in-car navigation architectures, CAN, ADAS, sensor inputs, and mapping technologies

  • Experience with command-line tools – Proficient using command prompt (Terminal), including tools like ADB (Android Debug Bridge), for device communication and diagnostics

  • Hands-on problem solving – Proactive and resourceful when diagnosing issues with mobile devices, vehicle interfaces, or other proprietary testing hardware

  • Safety-focused driver – Demonstrates safe driving practices at all times and acts as a safety champion during vehicle-based testing activities

  • Strong organizational skills – Able to manage multiple test threads, prioritize requests, and track execution across distributed teams

  • Effective communicator – Clear, concise communication across Slack, email, and meetings; able to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders

  • Tool proficiency – Experienced with collaboration and tracking tools such as Slack, Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Calendar), Jira, Confluence, and common bug reporting systems

  • Adaptable and detail-oriented – Comfortable shifting between field testing, planning, and coordination; maintains a high standard of accuracy and follow-through

  • Valid driver’s license and passport – Willingness and flexibility to perform in-vehicle testing and travel on short notice to support demos and testing in EU locations if needed.

What We Value

In addition to our core values, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

  • We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

  • We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.

  • We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

  • We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you have received the Mapbox Non-US Privacy Notice for applicants, which is linked here.  Completing this application requires you to provide personal data, such as your name and contact information, which is mandatory for Mapbox to process your application. 

We are committed to a fair and equitable hiring process. We do not discriminate against any protected class.

jobs.title: Data Services Operations Support Specialist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 4 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform’s flexibility, security and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers. 

What We Do:

High-quality data is the foundation of all Mapbox products. Data RAVE is a key division within Mapbox, which is responsible for acquiring, processing, and delivering high-quality location-oriented data to enable internal and external customers. The Road Closures team is responsible for managing traffic-related data within the system. This includes proactively adding, editing, and removing road closures to reflect real-world conditions, as well as responding to customer feedback to ensure that navigation remains accurate, reliable, and up-to-date.

What You'll Do:

  • You will review a large amount of traffic data (road incidents: constructions, closures, etc.), and feedback from customers to improve their experience

  • You will do a root-cause analysis using various data sources and tools to understand the customers’ issues

  • You will make high-quality edits on OSM and other internal data sources based on guidelines

  • You will provide investigations and analysis, find patterns, and write reports

  • You will interact closely with teammates, managers, and engineers to improve current tools, workflows, products, and services

What We Believe are Important Traits for This Role:

  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. Ability to work with large volumes of traffic data, identify patterns, and perform root-cause analysis

  • Quick learner: able to grasp new tools, workflows, and guidelines efficiently

  • English level: B1 (intermediate), both written and spoken — sufficient for daily communication, reading guidelines, and writing reports.

  • Willingness to work a 2/2 shift schedule from the office is required (2 days on, 2 days off), with day shift from 8:00am to 8:00pm and night shift from 8:00pm to 8:00am.

  • Basic knowledge of traffic regulations is required

Would Be a Plus:

  • Background in GIS, cartography; familiarity with OSM or similar mapping tools

  • Practical use of AI tools for data retrieval, automation, or workflow optimization

  • Solid knowledge of SQL, Python, JS, or low-code platforms for analysis and automation

  • Comfortable working with Jira and Confluence

What We Value

In addition to our core values, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

  • We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

  • We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.

  • We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

  • We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

High-quality data is the foundation of all Mapbox products. Data RAVE is a key division within Mapbox, which is responsible for acquiring, processing, and delivering high-quality location-oriented data to enable internal and external customers. The Road Closures team is responsible for managing traffic-related data within the system. This includes proactively adding, editing, and removing road closures to reflect real-world conditions, as well as responding to customer feedback to ensure that navigation remains accurate, reliable, and up-to-date.


WHAT YOU'LL DO:

 - You will review a large amount of traffic data (road incidents: constructions, closures, etc.), and feedback from customers to improve their experience

 - You will do a root-cause analysis using various data sources and tools to understand the customers’ issues

 - You will make high-quality edits on OSM and other internal data sources based on guidelines

 - You will provide investigations and analysis, find patterns, and write reports

 - You will interact closely with teammates, managers, and engineers to improve current tools, workflows, products, and services


WHAT WE BELIEVE ARE IMPORTANT TRAITS FOR THIS ROLE:

 - Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. Ability to work with large volumes of traffic data, identify patterns, and perform root-cause analysis

 - Quick learner: able to grasp new tools, workflows, and guidelines efficiently

 - English level: B1 (intermediate), both written and spoken — sufficient for daily communication, reading guidelines, and writing reports.

 - Willingness to work a 2/2 shift schedule from the office is required (2 days on, 2 days off), with day shift from 8:00am to 8:00pm and night shift from 8:00pm to 8:00am.

 - Basic knowledge of traffic regulations is required


WOULD BE A PLUS:

 - Background in GIS, cartography; familiarity with OSM or similar mapping tools

 - Practical use of AI tools for data retrieval, automation, or workflow optimization

 - Solid knowledge of SQL, Python, JS, or low-code platforms for analysis and automation

 - Comfortable working with Jira and Confluence


WHAT WE VALUE

In addition to our core values https://www.mapbox.com/about/values/, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

 - We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

 - We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.

 - We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

 - We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

jobs.title: Senior Business Development Manager, Automotive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 4 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform’s flexibility, security and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers. 

What You'll Do

Auto is undergoing a massive change towards electric and autonomous vehicles with a fully connected user experience - you’ve seen this in your work. At a time where these changes are actually reaching a tipping point, Mapbox delivers real-time updated maps, a polished user experience and AI vision enabling our OEM customers to build the future of mobility. We take a consultative, long-term partnership approach in developing business with our customers. We obsess with them about their drivers to create delightful experiences unique to their brand and we work with them to evolve in-car applications continuously throughout the lifetime of the vehicle.

As a Business Development Manager you’ll be responsible for the acquisition and management of some of the most valuable Japanese OEM accounts - Toyota, Nissan, Honda and others - many of whom we already work with. You will develop new opportunities around in-car navigation, augmented reality, ADAS and automated driving and manage our customer relationships from the first contact on. You’ll be the go-to person and senior advisor in everything related to location technology. You will develop term sheets for new projects and negotiate contracts that enable long-term account growth. You will engage partners in the automotive supplier space to position Mapbox for growth in the market. Location is a fundamental enabler of the future of mobility and the journey is just getting started. If you’re excited to build this future together with our customers, we’d love to hear from you.

  • Develop first of a kind opportunities with key accounts and advise customers on their location product strategy for navigation and automated driving products and lead complex proposal processes (RFI/RFQ/RFP) end to end

  • Build and foster connections with key senior decision makers, building lasting relationships between our partners and Mapboxr

  • Shape and translate the Mapbox value proposition specifically for the Japan market

  • Combine Mapbox building blocks with deep customer knowledge to present compelling technical solutions with clear business outcomes, particularly around in-car navigation, mobile companion applications, automated driving, augmented reality and electric vehicle routing

  • Involve the Mapbox product leadership directly in the business development process to shape our technical roadmap

What We Believe are Important Traits for This Role

  • Japanese and English proficiency required (verbal and written)

  • 10+ years of experience developing and negotiating complex deals involving a technical product

  • Consultative and solutions-oriented sales approach

  • Strong technical sales aptitude demonstrated through a combination of industry experience, size, and complexity of deals closed (you’ll be focused on seven and eight figure opportunities), and rapport with engineers and product owners

  • Ability to manage complex customer relationships, developing trust and influence with engineers & developers, and up to C-level leadership

  • Ability to collaborate across Mapbox teams including engineering, support, and marketing to close business and ensure successful customer launches

  • Deep curiosity, empathy, and grit — we’re partnering with our customers to solve hard problems, and we win as a team

What We Value

In addition to our core values, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

  • We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

  • We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.

  • We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

  • We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you agree to the Mapbox Privacy Policy which is linked here.

Mapbox participates in E-Verify to confirm employee work authorization. Please refer to the Notice of E-Verify Participation and Right to Work posters for more information.

We are committed to a fair and equitable hiring process. We do not discriminate against any protected class.

#LI-Remote

jobs.title: Automation Engineer II, Navigation SDK
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 4 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform’s flexibility, security and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers. 

What We Do

The Navigation SDK teams contribute to the development of navigation components and APIs that provide surface area for core navigation functionality such as routing, guidance, and voice controls. We work at the core of a Navigation SDK product serving customers with use cases ranging from turn-by-turn navigation for consumers embedded in next generation vehicles to delivery route planning for fleets of thousands of trucks. We get users from point A to point B effectively matching them on roads as accurately as possible. Serving customers like BMW, Toyota, Rivian, and Instacart is at the core of our mission, backed by our commitment to technical excellence and collaborative innovation. 

What You'll Do

We are seeking a Senior Automation Engineer with expertise in Python and Linux to support our development teams in maintaining and enhancing our SDK release systems and best practices.

In this role, you will manage the release systems and tools for creating, testing, and deploying Mapbox SDKs. You will work with engineering teams to build, package, and distribute Android, iOS products, and support automotive hardware development. Your expertise will enable you to effectively debug platform-specific build issues.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Integration and optimisation of build systems

  • Development and maintenance of continuous integration and deployment pipelines

  • Maintenance of automotive integration test systems

  • Defining and advocating for engineering best practices

  • Keeping up to date with technological developments and industry trends

What We Believe are Important Traits for This Role

  • Experience with mobile build systems (Gradle, Xcodebuild, etc.)

  • Prior experience with building and releasing for mobile (Android or iOS)

  • Prior experience writing and maintaining reusable CI/CD pipelines

  • Experience in creating and monitoring self-hosted CI/CD infrastructure

  • Passion for change/process management

  • Good at investigating and troubleshooting other people's code/apps

  • Skilled in communication and collaboration with others

  • Always looking to automate and make processes more efficient

  • Good documentation skills and experience with technical writing

Nice to Have Traits for This Role

  • Experience in the mapping, navigation, or automotive industry

  • Background in building and releasing software for embedded systems

  • Prior experience with effective tooling and organizations for monorepos

  • Experience developing Python-based tools to improve product quality and developer experience

  • Experience with CMake build system

  • Experience with hands-on C++ development

What We Value

In addition to our core values, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

  • We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

  • We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.

  • We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

  • We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you agree to the Mapbox Privacy Policy which is linked here.

Mapbox is an EEO Employer - Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

jobs.title: Automation Engineer II, Navigation SDK
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 4 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform’s flexibility, security and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers. 

What We Do

The Navigation SDK teams contribute to the development of navigation components and APIs that provide surface area for core navigation functionality such as routing, guidance, and voice controls. We work at the core of a Navigation SDK product serving customers with use cases ranging from turn-by-turn navigation for consumers embedded in next generation vehicles to delivery route planning for fleets of thousands of trucks. We get users from point A to point B effectively matching them on roads as accurately as possible. Serving customers like BMW, Toyota, Rivian, and Instacart is at the core of our mission, backed by our commitment to technical excellence and collaborative innovation.

What You'll Do

We are seeking a Senior Automation Engineer with expertise in Python and Linux to support our development teams in maintaining and enhancing our SDK release systems and best practices.

In this role, you will manage the release systems and tools for creating, testing, and deploying Mapbox SDKs. You will work with engineering teams to build, package, and distribute Android, iOS products, and support automotive hardware development. Your expertise will enable you to effectively debug platform-specific build issues.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Integration and optimisation of build systems

  • Development and maintenance of continuous integration and deployment pipelines

  • Maintenance of automotive integration test systems

  • Defining and advocating for engineering best practices

  • Keeping up to date with technological developments and industry trends

What We Believe are Important Traits for This Role

  • Experience with mobile build systems (Gradle, Xcodebuild, etc.)

  • Prior experience with building and releasing for mobile (Android or iOS)

  • Prior experience writing and maintaining reusable CI/CD pipelines

  • Experience in creating and monitoring self-hosted CI/CD infrastructure

  • Good at investigating and troubleshooting other people's code/apps

  • Skilled in communication and collaboration with others

  • Always looking to automate and make processes more efficient

  • Good documentation skills and experience with technical writing

Nice to Have Traits for This Role

  • Experience in the mapping, navigation, or automotive industry

  • Background in building and releasing software for embedded systems

  • Prior experience with effective tooling and organizations for monorepos

  • Experience developing Python-based tools to improve product quality and developer experience

  • Experience with CMake build system

  • Experience with hands-on C++ development

What We Value

In addition to our core values, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

  • We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

  • We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.

  • We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

  • We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you agree to the Mapbox Privacy Policy which is linked here.

Mapbox is an EEO Employer - Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

jobs.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer, HD Maps
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 4 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform’s flexibility, security and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers. 

What We Do

On the HD Maps team, we are at the forefront of geospatial big-data analytics and insights for customer market segments and product offerings. Our expertise is pivotal in deploying GIS algorithmic stages into scalable production cloud applications, leveraging platforms like AWS and Spark. We work on Mapbox's award-winning high-precision maps (“HD Maps”) products family, spanning across ADAS, AV, and Non-Automotive GIS data customers in numerous projects. We cover everything from data and systems analysis to automotive and cloud application architecture, including compute, storage, cost and performance assessments.

What You'll Do

Joining us as a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll play a key role in one of the aspects of developing software and tech for improving map features, navigation, and high-definition maps. You'll bring your experience and skills to our exciting project within a competent, cross-functional, passionate, and self-organized team.

In this role, you can expect to:

  • Take ownership of ML projects across the company.

  • Design and implement new feature extraction pipelines from open source and proprietary data;

  • Collect and monitor technical and business metrics;

  • Assume a key position in deliberating and implementing security best practices.

What We Believe are Important Traits for This Role

  • 5+ years of hands-on experience with Machine Learning / Data Science

  • Good knowledge of Python (or any other programming language);

  • Proficient in SQL operations;

  • End-to-end solution support;

  • Basic understanding of distributed computing principles;

  • To be creative, resourceful and innovative problem solver;

  • Good communication skills in English, both written and spoken.

Nice to Have Traits for This Role

  • Hands-on experience with Spark / PySpark / MapReduce;

  • Deep Learning / LMM will be a plus;

  • Experience with Hadoop (or similar) Ecosystem;

  • Experience with workflow management tools (Airflow / Oozie / Luigi / Prefect);

  • Experience with AWS services, in particular S3, EC2, IAM, EMR, Glue, Athena.

What We Value

In addition to our core values, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:

  • We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.

  • We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.

  • We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

  • We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you agree to the Mapbox Privacy Policy which is linked here.

We are committed to a fair and equitable hiring process. We do not discriminate against any protected class.


#LI-Remote
